Group17 contribution: Kartik(50%), Santhosh(50%)

design details:

    The system is designed using the primary server principle. A server is selected as a primary server in this server 
    cluster.
    In this project, turing36 or host 0, is the primary server. 
    The received messages are processed in the following manner:
        1. A READ message, when received by any server, responds back by sending a md5 digest of the data stored. The md5 
        digest is first converted into integer format and written to the first 32 bytes of data array. The size of the array
        will, however,     still remain 128 due to explicit size declaration beforehand in the structure of the message 
        itself. 
        The reply command is 11 (READ_REPLY), seq = 1 and the data[1-8] are the contents of md5 digest. data[9-31] has garbage
        values.
        2. The WRITE message, on the other hand, is treated a bit differently. The messages will always be first processed by 
        the primary server. Thus, any WRITE messages received by other servers are forwarded to the primary server. The 
        primary then enqueues this message. A different thread is responsible for handling the queue. Everytime the queue has 
        not empty, the front of the queue is popped to process the message within. Once the content is written to the primary
        server's data store, this message is then broadcasted to the other servers who then replicate the data store by 
        processing the message as well. While the message is broadcasted, the primary server waits to fetch the WRITE_ACK 
        from the replica servers. Once it receives a total of 3 WRITE_ACKs, the server replies back to the client by sending back a message with 
	      cmd = WRITE_ACK.
        Note: The underlying assumption is that the client always sends 32 words and no partial messages are being sent. In
        the case of partial messages, since the integer array has no sentinel value or counter to determine the length of the
        elements in the message data array, garbage values would be copied into the data store.

compiling instructions:

    Type 'make' or 'make receiver' to compile the servers side program.
    For Client side, use 'make send_msg'

Execution Sequence:

    To execute a server program, enter './receiver' into the terminal. 
    Servers used are:
    turing36.eecs.csuohio.edu 
    turing37.eecs.csuohio.edu
    turing38.eecs.csuohio.edu
    turing39.eecs.csuohio.edu

Sample Output:
    Note: Given pairs below are (index:value) pairs.
